issues.description: The problem statement refers to the REST endpoints with an "/api" prefix (e.g. "PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents"), while the template and solution controllers expose the endpoints without that prefix (e.g. "/persons/{personId}/parents"). This discrepancy can confuse students about which URL to call in integration tests or when manually exercising the API, and may lead them to implement or test against the wrong paths.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the endpoint paths consistent. Either (A) update the problem statement (and any task descriptions) to use the actual paths exposed by the controllers (e.g. "/persons/...") or (B) change the controllers to include the "/api" base path (for example add @RequestMapping(path = "/api", consumes = ..., produces = ...) at the class level or prefix each mapping with "api/"). Choose the option that matches project conventions and update tests/instructions accordingly.
